037package org.jfree.chart.plot.pie;
038
039import java.io.Serializable;
040import java.util.List;
041import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
042
043/**
044 * A base class for handling the distribution of pie section labels.  Create
045 * your own subclass and set it using the
046 * {@link PiePlot#setLabelDistributor(AbstractPieLabelDistributor)} method
047 * if you want to customise the label distribution.
048 */
049public abstract class AbstractPieLabelDistributor implements Serializable {
050
051    /** The label records. */
052    protected List labels;
053
054    /**
055     * Creates a new instance.
056     */
057    public AbstractPieLabelDistributor() {
058        this.labels = new java.util.ArrayList();
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Returns a label record from the list.
063     *
064     * @param index  the index.
065     *
066     * @return The label record.
067     */
068    public PieLabelRecord getPieLabelRecord(int index) {
069        return (PieLabelRecord) this.labels.get(index);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Adds a label record.
074     *
075     * @param record  the label record ({@code null} not permitted).
076     */
077    public void addPieLabelRecord(PieLabelRecord record) {
078        Args.nullNotPermitted(record, "record");
079        this.labels.add(record);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Returns the number of items in the list.
084     *
085     * @return The item count.
086     */
087    public int getItemCount() {
088        return this.labels.size();
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Clears the list of labels.
093     */
094    public void clear() {
095        this.labels.clear();
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Called by the {@link PiePlot} class.  Implementations should distribute
100     * the labels in this.labels then return.
101     *
102     * @param minY  the y-coordinate for the top of the label area.
103     * @param height  the height of the label area.
104     */
105    public abstract void distributeLabels(double minY, double height);
106
107}
